direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods provide a preview of subscription details but for different types of products (locked vs. flexible).
Both methods involve subscription processes with similar parameter handling and control flows.
Both methods access and manipulate locked product lists, which can be used to validate the subscription preview.
Both methods involve checking and potentially modifying the user's subscription quota for locked products.
Both methods handle similar types of exceptions related to subscription and redemption processes.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require the initialization of the RequestHandler for API requests.
The list of locked products is often required to set up the context for subscription previews.
Subscribing to a locked product should be tested before or after previewing the subscription to validate the process.
Checking the personal left quota should be done before or after the preview to ensure accurate subscription limits.
Both methods involve verifying subscription responses and handling similar exceptions.
The position of locked products should be verified after a subscription preview to ensure data consistency.
